titleStmt.title: C. L. Creekmore to Daniel C. Wickliffe
CWG7783

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p:
Whitley C. H. Ky
November 3rd 1862
Hon D. C Wickliffe
Secretary of state
Dr Sir

No mail has reached this place from the interior of the State since August last. You will find from the election returns in your office that I was at August last duly elected Presiding Judge of the County Court of this (Whitley) Co.
The mails will henceforth be regularly delivered here from northern points, will you therefore forward my Commission.
If the Commission has been sent out, I suggest the necessity of forwarding a duplicate, as much of the mail matter which is suspended by the way, never reaches its destination

I am sir very Respectfully
Your Obt Servt
C. L Creekmore

Whitley Co
Pr. Judge
C. L. Creekmore
Com Issd Nov 12 1862
